description: A teacher uploads a PDF of a language acquisition timeline, the platform extracts the developmental stages, creates a branched SCORM module that adapts to the learner's age, generates true/false milestone questions, validates the package and returns a download link.

messages.content: You are EduScormBuilder, an AI assistant that helps educators turn source materials into SCORM‑compatible e‑learning modules. Use the provided tools to upload files, extract text, identify key concepts, fetch templates, generate assessments, assemble, validate and store the final SCORM package.

Hi! I have a PDF that outlines the language acquisition timeline for children from birth to age 12. Could you create a branched SCORM module that adapts the content based on the learner’s age and includes true/false milestone questions for each stage?
Absolutely! Please upload the PDF file so I can start processing it.

Here is the file.

Filename: language_acquisition_timeline.pdf
Base64Content: JVBERi0xLjQKJaqrrK0KNCAwIG9iago8PAovVHlwZSAvWE9iamVjdAovU3VidHlwZSAvSW1hZ2UKL0JpdHNQZXJtZW50IDgKL0NvbG9yU3BhY2UgL0RldmljZVN0YXRlCj4+CmVuZG9iagoK
Got it. I will store the PDF in temporary storage.
{"file_id": "file_7f9e3d"}
The PDF is stored. I will now extract the plain‑text content so we can analyse the stages.

{"text": "Language Acquisition Timeline

Stage 1: Birth – 12 months – Babbling, first words
Stage 2: 1–3 years – Vocabulary spurt, two‑word sentences
Stage 3: 3–6 years – Grammar expansion, storytelling
Stage 4: 6–9 years – Reading fluency, complex sentences
Stage 5: 9–12 years – Abstract language, academic discourse", "page_count": 2}
Great, I have the text. Let me identify the key concepts and learning objectives for each age stage.

arguments.text:
Language Acquisition Timeline

Stage 1: Birth – 12 months – Babbling, first words
Stage 2: 1–3 years – Vocabulary spurt, two‑word sentences
Stage 3: 3–6 years – Grammar expansion, storytelling
Stage 4: 6–9 years – Reading fluency, complex sentences
Stage 5: 9–12 years – Abstract language, academic discourse

messages.content: {"concepts": ["Babbling and first words (0‑12 months)", "Vocabulary spurt (1‑3 years)", "Two‑word sentences (1‑3 years)", "Grammar expansion (3‑6 years)", "Storytelling (3‑6 years)", "Reading fluency (6‑9 years)", "Complex sentences (6‑9 years)", "Abstract language (9‑12 years)", "Academic discourse (9‑12 years)"], "learning_objectives": ["Identify milestones for each age range", "Explain why each milestone matters in language development"], "slide_titles": ["Stage 1: Birth‑12 months", "Stage 2: 1‑3 years", "Stage 3: 3‑6 years", "Stage 4: 6‑9 years", "Stage 5: 9‑12 years"]}
I’ll use a branched SCORM template so the learner sees only the stages relevant to their age. Let’s fetch that template.
{"template_id": "template_8e4f"}
Now I will generate true/false milestone questions for each stage based on the concepts.

{"assessment": [{"question": "Children under 12 months can form complex sentences.", "type": "true_false", "answer": false}, {"question": "The vocabulary spurt occurs between ages 1 and 3.", "type": "true_false", "answer": true}, {"question": "Two‑word sentences typically appear after age 6.", "type": "true_false", "answer": false}, {"question": "Grammar expansion is a key milestone between ages 3 and 6.", "type": "true_false", "answer": true}, {"question": "Storytelling skills emerge before reading fluency.", "type": "true_false", "answer": true}, {"question": "Reading fluency usually develops between ages 6 and 9.", "type": "true_false", "answer": true}, {"question": "Complex sentences are not expected until after age 12.", "type": "true_false", "answer": false}, {"question": "Abstract language skills start to appear around age 9.", "type": "true_false", "answer": true}, {"question": "Academic discourse is a milestone for learners older than 12.", "type": "true_false", "answer": false}]}
I’m ready to build the SCORM module. I will create slides for each stage, embed the PDF text where appropriate, and attach the assessment we just generated.

slides.title: Stage 1: Birth‑12 months
slides.html_body:
Stage 1: Birth‑12 months

Babbling and first words are the primary milestones.

questions.question: Children under 12 months can form complex sentences.
The vocabulary spurt occurs between ages 1 and 3.
Two‑word sentences typically appear after age 6.
Grammar expansion is a key milestone between ages 3 and 6.
Storytelling skills emerge before reading fluency.
Reading fluency usually develops between ages 6 and 9.
Complex sentences are not expected until after age 12.
Abstract language skills start to appear around age 9.
Academic discourse is a milestone for learners older than 12.
